file_content.text: Ah! Ah...! Just do it.
He and I aren't done!
Liser gar su jorhaa'ir haar joha, dar'manda? Ib'tuur gar dar'buir balyc.
Sushir! My last request, hunter. I want a moment to speak with my son.
Me'ven? Ner... ner ad? Oyayc? I have a last request, hunter. I want a moment to speak with my--my son.
You just had it.
Too bad. [Kill Jicoln]
Make your last request to Mandalore. I'm not killing you today.
Some other time. [Freeze him]
I can spare a few minutes. I'll be watching.
Go ahead.
You've got no business carrying your name like a mark of shame.
I fought a righteous battle. You'll never get me to admit otherwise.
I understand.
Take my head to "Mandalore" if you're gonna. I'm tired.
Rest in peace.
I will. [Kill Jicoln]
Mandalore can decide what to do with you himself.
I'm taking you in one piece.
This is your call to make, kid.
What do you think, Torian?
I'm sorry.
Now's your chance. Prove you're not a traitor like him.
You wanted to face him. Do it.
I know what I have to do.
Gar taldin ni jaonyc, gar sa buir, ori'wadaas'la.
I'll do our name proud.
That... wasn't what I expected.
I've got it from here, Torian.
I've business to attend to.
Right. Thanks for this.
You seem shook up; what'd he say to you?
You alright?
Nothing I didn't already know. Just differently told.
Grow up.
I want to be alone.
Got an opinion on the matter, Torian?
You want to talk to him, kid?
We won't be remembered as traitors.
It's over....
Thanks for this.
Just a business arrangement.
No thanks needed.
Your honor was on the line.
Glad to help.
I won't forget this.
This was about money, that's it.
I didn't do it for you.
Thanks anyway.
It's been an honor.
You gave a good run, my friend. Might have done me in if you hadn't left the finale to a novice.
You and Artus have something in common. You're content to let the young do your dying for you.
There's nowhere left to run, Jicoln.
This ends now.
This is as good a place as any for my last stand.
His life wasn't my responsibility, it was yours.
That blood's on your hands.
Is that how Mandalorians sleep at night these days?
That how you clear your conscience, bounty hunter?
Let's finish burying the past. This game's gone on long enough.
I'm so tired of your garbage.
Looks like we have something in common as well.
Let's dance, girl.
Let's see what you've got, boy.
He's toying with us. But the Geroya be Haran gives us an opening. It's a Mandalorian death game.
There are four parts: alii'jaate, personal honors; Yai'me'suum, the homeworld; the Sterebiise, who defends a legacy; and the Naast, who destroys it.
He will place honors, prized possessions, around a battlefield. You will try to take them. If you take all of them, then you must take his home.
I just wander the swamp looking for clues?
How do I find all this stuff?
This is a lot of trouble for a duel.
Is there a point to all this?
It's a war game. Mandalorian tradition. And it gets us close to him.
How do you know he'll just lay down if we win?
Will he cheat?
There are no rules for how. Plus he's no Mandalorian. Not anymore.
I'll scout for Jicoln's honors while you go to face him. Then while you run the game, I'll find his home. Call me when you've made your challenge.
Blast, blast, blast, blast... does this look infected to you?
Blizz want to go home now.
Why does everything always want to eat us?
So, is Artus finally sending children to do his dirty work?
Run home now, and tell "Mandalore" if he wants my head, he should come take it himself.
Mandalore's done with you, Jicoln. I'm not.
Not happening.
You gonna face me like a warrior or make me chase you all over Taris?
Let's not drag this out.
Think real hard, girl, before you go issuing challenges you might regret.
Think real hard, boy, before you go issuing challenges you might regret.
If a bunch of dirty mutants is the best you've got, you're as good as dead.
Was that supposed to scare me?
I will tell you what I told the others. You've survived; you have earned the right to the Geroya be Haran. If you lose, however, I will kill you.
I'll be waiting at these coordinates. Then we'll see who hunts whom.
Real nice guy, your dad.
Was he expecting us?
Personally? No.
